Congress eased back into session today, its first working day of President Obama's second term.

Majority Leader Harry Reid said today he's kept things at the starting point so that he and his fellow Democrats have the option of changing the rules on a filibuster by a simple majority vote.
The Senate will take action to make this institution that we all love, the United States Senate, work more effectively will consider changes to the Senate rules.
Reid said he hoped to reach agreement with Minority Leader Mitch McConnell in the next day or so on modifying the filibuster rules to make things work more smoothly.
